spanish: Tengo que irme a dormir.
english: I have to go to sleep.

spanish: Me gusta la luz de las velas.
english: I like candlelight.

spanish: No podemos dormir por el ruido.
english: We can't sleep because of the noise.

spanish: Demasiado tarde.
english: Too late.

spanish: Todas las mañanas y todas las noches le doy de comer a mi gato.
finnish: Syötän kissani joka aamu ja joka ilta.
english: I feed my cat every morning and every evening.

spanish: Volveré a llamar más tarde.
english: I'll call again later.

spanish: ¿Dónde está el baño?
english: Where is the toilet?

spanish: Mi hija tiene previsto casarse en junio.
english: My daughter is to get married in June.

spanish: Él dejó la puerta abierta.
english: He left the door open.

spanish: Hiciste una promesa.
english: You have made a promise.

spanish: A él le gusta cocinar para su familia.
finnish: Hänestä on mukavaa laittaa ruokaa perheelleen.
english: He likes cooking for his family.

spanish: Llegué tarde a la escuela por un accidente.
english: I was late for school on account of an accident.

spanish: Él escondió los juguetes bajo la cama.
english: He hid his toys under the bed.

spanish: Jim lleva tres días en cama con la gripe.
finnish: Jim on maannut flunssassa kolme päivää.
english: Jim has been laid up with flu for three days.

spanish: ¿Lloverá mañana?
english: Is it going to rain tomorrow?

spanish: ¿Está tu madre en casa?
english: Is your mother at home now?

spanish: El bebé lloró toda la noche.
english: The baby cried all night.

spanish: ¿Venden ustedes zapatos deportivos?
english: Do you sell sport shoes?

spanish: ¿Cuánto cuesta la silla de madera?
english: How much does the wooden chair cost?

spanish: Quiero limpiar la casa antes de que vuelvan mis padres.
finnish: Haluan siivota talon ennen kuin vanhempani tulevat takaisin.
english: I want to clean the house before my parents return.

spanish: Tengo que limpiar mi habitación.
english: I have to clean my room.

spanish: El ruido va a despertar al bebé.
english: The noise will wake the baby up.

spanish: Hacía mucho frío ayer por la mañana.
english: It was very cold yesterday morning.

spanish: ¿Qué comiste para desayunar?
english: What did you eat for breakfast?

spanish: Perdóname por haber roto mi promesa.
english: Forgive me for breaking my promise.

spanish: Vete a dormir.
english: Just go to sleep.

spanish: Mi mujer está cocinando.
english: My wife is cooking.

spanish: Buenas noches. Dulces sueños.
english: Good night. Sweet dreams.

spanish: ¡Me voy a la cama!
english: I'm going to bed.

spanish: Estoy intentando dormir.
english: I'm trying to sleep.

spanish: Hay una naranja sobre la mesa.
english: There's an orange on the table.

spanish: Ojalá me hubiera casado con ella.
finnish: Olisinpa vaan mennyt hänen kanssaan naimisiin.
english: I wish I had married her.

spanish: Hay un gato en la cocina.
english: There is a cat in the kitchen.

spanish: Esta mesa está reservada.
english: This table is reserved.

spanish: Ella está casada con un extranjero.
english: She is married to a foreigner.

spanish: Lo encontré tumbado sobre la cama.
english: I found him lying on the bed.

spanish: Él entró por la ventana.
english: He came in through the window.

spanish: Él está orgulloso de no haber llegado nunca tarde a clase.
finnish: Hän on ylpeä siitä, että hän ei ole koskaan tullut oppitunnille myöhässä.
english: He is proud of never having been late for school.

spanish: Hasta mañana.
english: See you again tomorrow.

spanish: Lamento llegar tarde.
english: I'm sorry about being late.

spanish: Llegué tarde a la escuela.
english: I was late to school.

spanish: ¿Estás casado?
english: Are you married?

spanish: Enciende la luz, por favor.
english: Turn on the light, please.

spanish: Deberías desayunar todos los días.
finnish: Sinun pitäisi syödä aamupalaa joka päivä.
english: You should have breakfast every day.

spanish: Él vino a mi habitación.
english: He came into my room.

spanish: Buenas noches, que duermas bien.
english: Good night, sleep tight.

spanish: Mi madre cocina bien.
english: My mother cooks well.

spanish: ¿Dónde está su libro? "Está sobre la mesa."
english: Where is her book? "It's on the table."

spanish: Él siempre llega tarde a la escuela.
english: He is always late for school.

spanish: Nos casamos hace siete años.
english: We married seven years ago.

spanish: La casa está embrujada.
english: The house is haunted.

spanish: Había un gato sobre la mesa.
english: On the table there was a cat.

spanish: Hay una escuela cerca de mi casa.
english: There is a school near my house.

spanish: Hay una manzana sobre la mesa.
english: There is an apple on the table.

spanish: ¡Buenas noches!
english: Goodnight!

spanish: Cierra la puerta al salir.
english: Close the door when you leave.

spanish: Cierra la puerta cuando te vayas.
english: Close the door when you leave.

spanish: Encendí la luz.
english: I turned on the lights.

spanish: Papá no está en casa.
english: Dad's not home.

spanish: Mañana viene mi tío a visitarnos.
english: My uncle is coming to see us tomorrow.

spanish: Hay un libro sobre la mesa.
english: There is a book on the table.

spanish: Un gato estaba sentado en la silla.
english: A cat was sitting on the chair.

spanish: Querido, ven a la cama. "No, todavía no. Aún debo traducir algunas frases en Tatoeba."
finnish: ”Kulta, tule sänkyyn.” ”Ei vielä. Minun täytyy vielä kääntää pari lausetta Tatoebassa.”
english: Honey, come to bed. "No, not yet. I still have to translate some sentences on Tatoeba."

spanish: ¿Dónde está tu habitación?
english: Where is your room?

spanish: ¿Cómo se siente estar de vuelta en casa?
english: How does it feel to be back home?

spanish: Me escondí debajo de la mesa.
english: I hid under the table.

spanish: Todas las casas en esta vecindad se parecen tanto que no las puedo distinguir.
finnish: Kaikki tämän asuinalueen talot näyttävät niin samanlaisilta, että en erota niitä toisistaan.
english: All the houses in this neighborhood look so much alike that I can't tell them apart.

spanish: ¿Podrías cerrar la ventana?
english: Could you close the window, please?

spanish: Nunca hago la cama.
english: I never make my bed.

spanish: La casa está fría.
english: The house is cold.

spanish: Estos zapatos son de ella.
english: These shoes are hers.

spanish: Maria gasta mucho dinero en ropa.
english: Maria spends a lot of money on clothes.

spanish: Él vive en una casa grande.
english: He lives in a big house.

spanish: Tu casa es grande.
english: Your house is big.

spanish: Lo haré mañana.
english: I'll do it tomorrow.

spanish: Era una noche oscura y tormentosa.
english: It was a dark and stormy night.

spanish: Escribí una carta ayer por la noche.
english: I wrote a letter last night.

spanish: Mi madre está en la cocina.
english: My mother is in the kitchen.

spanish: ¿Puedes apagar la luz?
english: Could you turn off the lights?

spanish: Tomaba un baño cuando el teléfono sonó.
english: I was taking a bath when the telephone rang.

spanish: Puede que ella venga mañana.
english: Perhaps she will come tomorrow.

spanish: Él llegó treinta minutos tarde.
english: He turned up 30 minutes late.

spanish: Iker Casillas es el mejor portero del mundo.
finnish: Iker Casillas on maailman paras maalivahti.
english: Iker Casillas is the best goalie in the world.

spanish: Ésa es su casa.
english: That is his house.

spanish: Follaron toda la noche.
english: They fucked all night long.

spanish: ¿A qué hora sueles irte a dormir?
english: What time do you usually go to bed?

spanish: Su casa no está lejos de aquí.
finnish: Hänen kotinsa ei ole kaukana täältä.
english: His house is not far from here.

spanish: Tarde o temprano él me dirá todo.
finnish: Hän kertoo kaiken minulle ennemmin tai myöhemmin.
english: Sooner or later he will tell me everything.

spanish: Hay un perro debajo de la mesa.
english: There is a dog under the table.

spanish: Nuestro gato está en la cocina.
english: Our cat is in the kitchen.

spanish: Mañana es su cumpleaños.
english: Tomorrow is her birthday.

spanish: Siempre estoy en casa los domingos.
english: I am always at home on Sundays.

spanish: ¡Buenas noches a todos!
english: Good night, everybody!

spanish: Anoche se me ocurrió una buena idea.
finnish: Minulle tuli viime yönä mieleen hyvä idea.
english: A good idea occurred to me last night.

spanish: Su casa está muy lejos de la estación.
finnish: Hänen talonsa on hyvin kaukana asemalta.
english: His house is very far from the station.

spanish: Dejé la puerta abierta.
english: I left the door open.

spanish: No pude dormir.
english: I couldn't sleep.

spanish: Apenas tenemos tiempo para desayunar.
english: We hardly have time to eat breakfast.

spanish: ¡Buenas tardes!
english: Good afternoon.

spanish: Se casaron hace tres meses.
finnish: He menivät naimisiin kolme kuukautta sitten.
english: They got married three months ago.

spanish: Volvió dos días más tarde.
finnish: Hän tuli takaisin kaksi päivää myöhemmin.
english: He came back two days later.

spanish: Deja que te lleve a casa.
english: Let me take you home.

spanish: ¿Estás contento con tu nueva casa?
english: Are you pleased with your new house?

spanish: Tengo una casa en las montañas.
english: I have a house in the mountains.

spanish: Me quedé en casa para descansar.
english: I stayed home to rest.

spanish: Ya es demasiado tarde.
english: It's already too late.

spanish: Te llamaré cuando llegue a casa.
english: I'll give you a call when I get home.

spanish: El baño está listo.
english: The bath is ready.

spanish: ¿Cuándo te vas a casar?
english: When will you get married?

spanish: Estaré allí mañana.
english: I'll be there tomorrow.

spanish: Tengo muchas cosas que hacer esta tarde.
finnish: Minulla on paljon tekemistä tänään iltapäivällä.
english: I have a lot of things to do this afternoon.

spanish: Ella tenía puesto un traje de baño rojo.
english: She was dressed in a red bathing suit.

spanish: Fue una noche oscura.
english: It was a dark night.

spanish: ¿Saliste anoche?
english: Were you out last night?

spanish: La puerta se cierra automáticamente.
english: The door locks automatically.

spanish: ¿Qué harías si el mundo se acabara mañana?
finnish: Mitä tekisit, jos huomenna olisi tulossa maailmanloppu?
english: What would you do if the world were to come to an end tomorrow?

spanish: Buenas tardes.
english: Good afternoon.

spanish: A mí me gusta la luz de las velas.
english: I like candlelight.

spanish: Me quedaré en casa.
english: I'll stay home.

spanish: Tu habitación es el doble de grande que la mía.
finnish: Huoneesi on kaksi kertaa omaani suurempi.
english: Your room is twice the size of mine.

spanish: Trabajo tres horas cada domingo por la mañana.
finnish: Minä työskentelen kolme tuntia joka sunnuntaiaamu.
english: I work for three hours every Sunday morning.

spanish: Tuve un sueño extraño anoche.
english: I had a strange dream last night.

spanish: Encontré mis zapatos.
english: I found my shoes.

spanish: Esta casa tiene seis habitaciones.
english: This house has six rooms.

spanish: La luz se desplaza más rápido que el sonido.
english: Light travels faster than sound.

spanish: La casa está ardiendo.
english: The house is burning.

spanish: Me molesta que llegue siempre tarde.
finnish: Minua häiritsee, että hän aina myöhästyy.
english: It bothers me that she's always late.

spanish: Me desperté y vi un ladrón en mi habitación.
finnish: Mä heräsin ja näin varkaan mun huoneessa.
english: I awoke to find a burglar in my room.

spanish: ¿A qué hora te vas a dormir?
english: What time do you go to bed?

spanish: María se gasta mucho dinero en ropa.
english: Maria spends a lot of money on clothes.

spanish: ¿Te molesta si abro la ventana?
english: Do you mind if I open the window?

spanish: Cuando ella le abrió su corazón, era demasiado tarde.
finnish: Kun hän avasi sydämensä hänelle, se oli jo liian myöhäistä.
english: When she opened her heart to him, it was already too late.

spanish: Estoy en casa.
english: I'm home.

spanish: Les llamaré mañana cuando regrese.
finnish: Soitan heille huomenna, kun tulen takaisin.
english: I'll call them tomorrow when I come back.

spanish: ¿Estás libre esta tarde?
english: Are you free this afternoon?

spanish: No puedo abrir la puerta. ¿Tenés la llave?
finnish: En saa ovea auki. Onko sinulla avain?
english: I can't open the door. Do you have the key?

spanish: Ella prometió casarse con él.
finnish: Hän lupasi mennä naimisiin hänen kanssaan.
english: She promised to marry him.

spanish: La noche era tan oscura, casi tan oscura como su corazón.
finnish: Yö oli niin pimeä, melkein yhtä pimeä kuin hänen sydämensä.
english: The night was so dark, almost as dark as her heart.

spanish: El techo de mi casa es rojo.
english: The roof of my house is red.

spanish: Las ventanas están abiertas.
english: The windows are open.

spanish: ¡Hasta mañana!
english: See you tomorrow!

spanish: ¡La casa se está incendiando!
english: The house is on fire!

spanish: No puedo dormir con tanto ruido.
english: I can't sleep with all this noise.

spanish: No puedo dormir con todo este jaleo.
english: I can't sleep with all this noise.

spanish: No puedo dormir con este alboroto.
english: I can't sleep with all this noise.

spanish: Sally obligó a su hermano a limpiar el baño.
english: Sally made his brother clean the bathroom.

spanish: A partir de mañana, esta dirección de correo electrónico será inválida.
finnish: Huomisesta lähtien tämä sähköpostiosoite on poissa käytöstä.
english: As of tomorrow, this e-mail address will be invalid.

spanish: Anoche comimos arroz con curry.
english: We ate curry rice last night.

spanish: Estoy disponible esta noche.
english: I'm free this evening.

spanish: ¿Estáis en casa?
english: Are you all home?

spanish: Por favor, apaga la luz cuando dejes la habitación.
english: Please put the light out when you leave the room.

spanish: Deberías apagar la luz antes de irte a dormir.
finnish: Sinun pitäisi sammuttaa valot ennen nukkumaan menemistä.
english: You should turn off the light before going to sleep.

spanish: Él ha roto la ventana intencionadamente.
english: He broke the window intentionally.

spanish: Estuve fuera de casa durante todas las vacaciones de verano.
finnish: Olin poissa kotoa koko kesäloman ajan.
english: I was away from home all through the summer vacation.

spanish: Siempre mantengo mis promesas.
english: I always keep my promises.

spanish: Mi hija se va a casar en junio.
english: My daughter is getting married in June.

spanish: Mi habitación es la número cinco.
english: My room is number five.

spanish: Volveremos a los detalles de este problema más tarde.
english: We'll return to the details of this problem later.

spanish: Mañana estudiaré mucho.
english: I'll study hard tomorrow.

spanish: ¿Y qué si él fracasa?
english: If he fails, so what?

spanish: Hay un incendio en mi cocina.
english: There's a fire in my kitchen.

spanish: Era mi turno de limpiar la habitación.
english: It was my turn to clean the room.

spanish: Yo le temo a la oscuridad.
english: I'm afraid of the dark.

spanish: Tom tuvo una entrevista de trabajo esta mañana.
english: Tom had a job interview this morning.

spanish: Ellos partieron anoche.
english: They set out last night.

spanish: La puerta no abre.
english: The door doesn't open.

spanish: Mi casa está cerca del parque.
english: My house is close to the park.

spanish: ¿Qué tiene de malo estar desnudo en tu propia casa?
finnish: Mitä vikaa on olla alasti omassa kodissaan!
english: What's wrong with being nude in your own house?

spanish: Estoy casado con una polaca.
english: I am married to a Polish woman.

spanish: Él estaba ebrio y olvidó cerrar la puerta trasera.
finnish: Hän oli juovuksissa ja unohti sulkea takaoven.
english: He was drunk and forgot to shut the back door.

spanish: ¡La casa está ardiendo!
english: The house is on fire!

spanish: Yo llegué más tarde de lo acostumbrado.
english: I arrived later than usual.

spanish: La casa en la que estoy viviendo no es muy grande.
finnish: Talo jossa asun ei ole kovin suuri.
english: The house I'm living in isn't very large.

spanish: Anoche Tom tuvo un sueño extraño.
finnish: Tom näki viime yönä outoa unta.
english: Tom had a weird dream last night.

spanish: Es de mañana aquí en mi huso horario.
finnish: Täällä minun aikavyöhykkeelläni on nyt aamu.
english: It's morning here in my time zone.

spanish: Disculpe, camarero. Hay un pelo en mi sopa.
english: Excuse me, waiter. There's a hair in my soup.

spanish: Llegué tarde a casa.
english: I came back home late.

spanish: ¿Vuelves mañana?
english: Are you coming back tomorrow?

spanish: Anoche tuve un sueño extraño.
english: I had a strange dream last night.

spanish: ¡Te veo más tarde!
english: See you later!

spanish: Tom debería haberse casado con Mary.
finnish: Tomin olisi pitänyt mennä naimisiin Marin kanssa.
english: Tom should have married Mary.

spanish: Su hermano es casado, pero no tiene hijos.
finnish: Hänen veljensä on naimisissa, mutta hänellä ei ole lapsia.
english: His brother is married, but he doesn't have children.

spanish: ¿Cuántas lenguas hay en Europa?
english: How many languages are there in Europe?

spanish: Sobre la mesa había un gato.
english: On the table there was a cat.

spanish: Di a luz a mi primer hijo el año pasado.
english: I gave birth to my first child last year.

spanish: Todas las plantas necesitan luz y agua.
finnish: Kaikki kasvit tarvitsevat vettä ja valoa.
english: All plants need water and light.

spanish: Él trabajaba de noche y dormía de día.
finnish: Hän työskenteli öisin ja nukkui päivisin.
english: He worked at night and slept in the daytime.

spanish: El problema es que no tenemos donde quedarnos esta noche.
finnish: Ongelma on se, ettei meillä ole yösijaa täksi yöksi.
english: The trouble is that we have nowhere to stay tonight.

spanish: Tom no quiere irse a casa.
english: Tom doesn't want to go home.

spanish: El gato está debajo de la mesa.
english: The cat is under the table.

spanish: ¿A qué hora sueles ir a dormir?
english: What time do you usually go to bed?

spanish: ¿Por qué está la luz encendida?
english: Why is the light on?

spanish: Alguien llamó a la puerta.
english: Somebody knocked at the door.

spanish: No me gusta el color de esta casa.
english: I don't like the colour of this house.

spanish: Esta silla está rota.
english: This chair is broken.

spanish: Tom está en casa casi todas las noches.
finnish: Tom on kotona lähes joka ilta.
english: Tom is at home almost every evening.

spanish: La guerra comenzó cinco años más tarde.
english: War began five years later.

spanish: La guerra estalló cinco años más tarde.
english: War began five years later.

spanish: Los ojos de los gatos son muy sensibles a la luz.
english: Cats' eyes are very sensitive to light.

spanish: En la cocina falta un lavavajillas.
english: The kitchen lacks a dishwasher.

spanish: Tom salió con su novia la noche del sábado.
english: Tom took his girlfriend out on Saturday night.

spanish: Tom rara vez llega tarde.
english: Tom is rarely late.

spanish: No había baño.
english: There was no bathroom.

spanish: Escogí estos en lugar de los zapatos.
english: I chose these over the shoes.

spanish: No dejes abiertas las ventanas.
english: Don't leave the windows open.

spanish: La puerta no cierra.
english: The door won't close.

spanish: Voy a estar ahí mañana.
english: I will be there tomorrow.

spanish: Voy a estar allí mañana.
english: I will be there tomorrow.

spanish: Tom ha estado casado tres veces.
finnish: Tom on ollut naimisissa kolme kertaa.
english: Tom has been married three times.

spanish: Tom tiene mucho sueño porque anoche no durmió bien.
finnish: Tomi on todella väsynyt, koska hän ei nukkunut hyvin viime yönä.
english: Tom is very sleepy, because he didn't sleep well last night.

spanish: Mi papá va a trotar todas las mañanas.
english: My father goes jogging every morning.

spanish: Ella limpió su habitación con prisa.
english: She cleaned her room in a hurry.

spanish: La luz se puso roja.
english: The light turned red.

spanish: Alguien rompió la ventana.
english: Someone broke the window.

spanish: Me levanté cuando todavía era de noche.
finnish: Nousin sängystä, kun oli vielä pimeää.
english: I got up while it was still dark.

spanish: Terminó la guerra en Europa.
english: The war in Europe ended.

spanish: Ella puso su casa en venta.
english: She has put her house up for sale.

spanish: ¿A qué hora fuiste a dormir ayer?
english: What time did you go to sleep yesterday?

spanish: Ella entró por la puerta trasera para que no la vieran.
finnish: Hän tuli sisään takaovesta, ettei häntä huomattaisi.
english: She came in through the back door lest she be seen.

spanish: Nadie me dijo que había fracasado.
finnish: Kukaan ei kertonut minulle, että hän oli epäonnistunut.
english: No one told me that she had failed.

spanish: La puerta está abierta. Voy a cerrarla.
finnish: Ovi on auki. Minä suljen sen.
english: The door is open. I'll go and shut it.

spanish: Tengo que quedarme en casa.
english: I have to stay home.

spanish: Tom fue directo a la cama.
english: Tom went straight to bed.

spanish: Vivo en la casa.
english: I live in the house.

spanish: Él se queda levantado hasta tarde.
english: He sits up till late at night.

spanish: Estaba borracho y se le olvidó cerrar la puerta de atrás.
finnish: Hän oli juovuksissa ja unohti sulkea takaoven.
english: He was drunk and forgot to shut the back door.

spanish: Ya era demasiado tarde.
english: It was already very late.

spanish: Llamame mañana.
english: Call me tomorrow.

spanish: Tengo que ir al baño.
english: I have to go to the bathroom.

spanish: No quiero limpiar caca de perro.
english: I don't wanna clean up dog shit.

spanish: Mucha gente se casa los sábados.
english: Lots of people get married on Saturdays.

spanish: Tom no tiene ganas de cocinar.
english: Tom doesn't feel like cooking.

spanish: Esa es la casa en la que me quedé.
english: That's the house I stayed in.

spanish: Yo vivo en esta casa.
english: This is the house I live in.

spanish: ¡Conducir en la oscuridad se siente como volar!
english: Driving in the dark feels like flying!

spanish: Ella está acostumbrada a levantarse temprano.
english: She is accustomed to rising early.

spanish: Mi papá está en el baño afeitándose.
english: My father is shaving in the bathroom.

spanish: No tengo nada que hacer esta tarde.
finnish: Minulla ei tänään iltapäivällä ole mitään tehtävää.
english: I have nothing to do this afternoon.

spanish: Una promesa no es suficiente.
english: A promise is not enough.

spanish: ¿Por qué no compartimos una habitación?
english: Why don't we share a room?

spanish: Cuando él regresó a casa, los chicos ya se habían dormido.
finnish: Kun hän palasi kotiin, lapset olivat jo unessa.
english: When he returned home, the kids were already asleep.

spanish: Esa es mi silla preferida.
english: That's my favorite chair.

spanish: Me quité los zapatos.
english: I took my shoes off.

spanish: Adiós. Hasta mañana.
english: Goodbye. See you tomorrow.

spanish: La noche era fría.
english: The night was cold.

spanish: Vomité anoche.
english: Last night I threw up.

spanish: A ese color le decimos "azul medianoche".
english: We call that color "midnight blue".

spanish: Él se olvidó de apagar la luz.
english: He forgot to turn off the light.

spanish: Tomo el desayuno cada mañana.
english: I have breakfast every morning.

spanish: Vi el rostro de un hombre en la ventana.
english: I saw a man's face in the window.

spanish: ¿Está el gato encima o debajo de la silla?
finnish: Onko kissa tuolilla vai sen alla?
english: Is the cat on the chair or under the chair?

spanish: Ellos viven en una casa grande.
english: They live in a big house.

spanish: No dormiré esta noche.
english: I won't sleep tonight.

spanish: Hoy voy a limpiar tu habitación.
english: I'm going to clean your bedroom today.

spanish: El informe meteorológico dice que lloverá mañana por la tarde.
finnish: Säätiedote sanoo, että huomenna iltapäivällä sataa.
english: The weather report says it will rain tomorrow afternoon.

spanish: Mi hija se casará en junio.
english: My daughter will get married in June.

spanish: No va a llover esta noche.
english: It isn't going to rain tonight.

spanish: Todas las casas temblaban y las alarmas sonaban en todas partes.
finnish: Kaikki talot tärähtelivät ja hälytykset soivat kaikkialla.
english: All the houses were shaking and alarms were ringing everywhere.

spanish: Pedí prestada una mesa.
english: I've borrowed a table.

spanish: Tom acaba de instalar un sistema de alarma en su casa.
finnish: Tom on juuri asentanut hälytysjärjestelmän taloonsa.
english: Tom has just installed an alarm system in his house.

spanish: ¿Acaso viste lo grande que es su casa?
finnish: Näitkö kuinka iso heidän talonsa on?
english: Did you see how big their house is?

spanish: Hay una ventana a tu izquierda.
english: There is a window on your left.

spanish: Se suponía que Tom me ayudara esta tarde.
finnish: Tomin oletettiin auttavan minua tänä iltapäivänä.
english: Tom was supposed to help me this afternoon.

spanish: Tom estaba aliviado al oír que María había llegado sana y salva a casa.
finnish: Tom oli helpottunut kuullessaan että Mary oli saapunut turvallisesti kotiin.
english: Tom was relieved to hear that Mary had arrived home safely.

spanish: Por favor, quítate los zapatos.
english: Please take off your shoes.

spanish: Ella está acostumbrada a quedarse despierta toda la noche.
finnish: Hän on tottunut olemaan valveilla koko yön.
english: She is used to staying up all night.

spanish: Él se fue a dormir temprano ya que estaba cansado.
finnish: Hän meni sänkyyn aikaisin, koska hän oli väsynyt.
english: Since he was tired, he went to bed early.

spanish: Una mañana él vio a una linda chica.
finnish: Eräänä aamuna hän näki sievän tytön.
english: One morning he saw a pretty girl.

spanish: No le abras la puerta a nadie.
english: Don't open the door for anybody.

spanish: Tom tuvo una cita con Mary anoche.
finnish: Tomilla oli treffit Maryn kanssa eilen illalla.
english: Tom had a date with Mary last night.

spanish: Me llamo Tom y seré su camarero esta noche.
finnish: Nimeni on Tom ja tulen olemaan palvelijanne tänä iltana.
english: My name is Tom and I'll be your server tonight.

spanish: Tu habitación está sucia.
english: Your room is dirty.

spanish: El partido de fútbol es mañana.
english: The football game is tomorrow.

spanish: Tom cada tarde da un paseo.
english: Tom goes for a walk every afternoon.

spanish: Le tengo miedo a la oscuridad.
english: I'm afraid of the dark.

spanish: Se paró detrás de la silla.
english: He stood behind the chair.

spanish: ¿Qué está haciendo esta silla aquí?
english: What's this chair doing here?

spanish: No estamos casados.
english: We're not married.

spanish: ¿Puedes empezar mañana?
english: Can you start tomorrow?

spanish: Se usó un martillo para romper la ventana.
english: A hammer was used to break the window.

spanish: ¿Comes en casa o comes fuera?
english: Do you eat at home or eat out?

spanish: Tom llega tarde al colegio bastante seguido.
finnish: Tom on melko usein myöhässä koulusta.
english: Tom is quite often late for school.

spanish: No estoy seguro de si me debería quedar en casa o salir.
finnish: En ole varma pysyäkö kotona vai mennäkö ulos.
english: I'm not sure whether to stay home or go out.

spanish: Yo hice esta silla.
english: I made this chair.

spanish: Tom está casado.
english: Tom is married.

spanish: Esta ropa mía está pasada de moda.
english: These clothes of mine are out of style.

spanish: Tom abrió la puerta.
english: Tom opened the door.

spanish: El doctor aconsejó que mi madre se quedara tres días más en cama.
finnish: Lääkäri ohjeisti että äitini pysyy sängyssä vielä kolme päivää.
english: The doctor advised that my mother stay in bed for three more days.

spanish: Nos da ropa.
english: She gives us clothes.

spanish: Se lo diré a Tom más tarde.
english: I'll tell Tom later.

spanish: Solo esta mañana llegué aquí.
finnish: Minä vasta tulin tänne tänä aamuna.
english: I just got here this morning.

spanish: ¿Quién piensas que estaba viendo la televisión en esta habitación ayer por la noche?
finnish: Kenen luulet katsoneen tv:tä tässä huoneessa eilen illalla?
english: Who do you think was watching TV in this room last night?

spanish: Normalmente se va a trabajar a las ocho de la mañana.
finnish: Hän menee yleensä töihin kello kahdeksan.
english: He usually goes to work at 8 a.m.

spanish: La casa en que vivo no es muy grande.
finnish: Talo jossa asun ei ole kovin suuri.
english: The house I'm living in isn't very large.

spanish: Mary necesita nuevos zapatos.
english: Mary needs new shoes.

spanish: Esta habitación tiene tres ventanas.
english: This room has three windows.

spanish: Me fui a la cama a la una.
english: I went to bed at one o'clock.

spanish: Mira la casa con el techo rojo.
english: Look at the house with the red roof.

spanish: Quiero vivir en casa con mi familia.
english: I want to live at home with my family.

spanish: El sol entrega luz y calor.
english: The sun gives light and heat.

spanish: No estoy casado.
english: I'm not married.

spanish: No estoy casada.
english: I'm not married.

spanish: Europa no es un país.
english: Europe is not a country.

spanish: Movamos la mesa.
english: Let's move the table.

spanish: Esta silla es incómoda.
english: This chair is uncomfortable.

spanish: ¿Qué está haciendo el mapache en la cocina?
english: What is the racoon doing in the kitchen?

spanish: Construí una casa nueva.
english: I built a new house.

spanish: Tom se pasó todo el día solo en su habitación.
finnish: Tom vietti koko päivän yksin huoneessaan.
english: Tom spent all day alone in his room.

spanish: Tom suele estar en casa los domingos por la tarde.
english: Tom is usually at home on Sunday evenings.

spanish: El libro está sobre la mesa.
english: The book is on the table.

spanish: El libro está en la mesa.
english: The book is on the table.

spanish: Llegamos un poco tarde.
english: We've arrived a little late.

spanish: Había harta comida en la casa.
english: There was much food in the house.

spanish: Se oía mucho ruido en la habitación, así que Tom se tapó los oídos.
finnish: Huoneessa oli todella meluisaa, niinpä Tom peitti korvansa.
english: It was really noisy in the room so Tom covered his ears.

spanish: Tom quería casarse con Mary.
finnish: Tomi halusi mennä Marin kanssa naimisiin.
english: Tom wanted to marry Mary.

spanish: La llave está en la mesa.
english: The key is on the table.

spanish: Tom llamó para decirle a Mary que vendría más tarde.
finnish: Tom soitti sanoakseen Marylle, että hän tulisi myöhemmin.
english: Tom called to tell Mary that he'd be late.

spanish: La he visto paseando por el parque a medianoche.
english: I saw her taking a walk in the park at midnight.

spanish: Buenas noches.
english: Good evening.

spanish: ¿Tienes algo que hacer mañana a esta hora?
finnish: Täytyykö sinun tehdä jotakin huomenna tähän aikaan?
english: What'll you be doing at this time tomorrow?

spanish: Tom cerró la ventana.
english: Tom shut the window.

spanish: Esta mesa es blanca.
english: This table is white.

spanish: Tom vende su casa.
english: Tom is selling his house.

spanish: Tengo una casa azul.
english: I have a blue house.

spanish: No olvides lavarte las manos.
english: Don't forget to wash your hands.

spanish: Ellos cubrieron la mesa con una tela.
english: They covered the table with a cloth.

spanish: Mañana vuelo a Boston.
english: I'm flying to Boston tomorrow.

spanish: ¿Por qué no mañana?
english: Why not tomorrow?

spanish: Estaba a punto de salir de la casa cuando sonó el teléfono.
finnish: Olin juuri lähdössä talosta, kun puhelin soi.
english: I was just about to leave the house when the telephone rang.

spanish: ¿A quién le toca lavar los platos?
english: Whose turn is it to wash the dishes?

spanish: Él ya no está en casa.
english: He is no longer at home.

spanish: Un fotógrafo le tomó una foto a mi casa.
english: A photographer took a photograph of my house.

spanish: Un fotógrafo sacó una foto de mi casa.
english: A photographer took a photograph of my house.

spanish: ¿De verdad quieres una taza de café tan tarde por la noche?
finnish: Haluatko todella kupin kahvia näin myöhään illalla?
english: Do you really want a cup of coffee this late at night?

spanish: ¿Cuándo vino a casa tu padre?
english: When did your father come home?

spanish: Tom no pudo abrir la puerta.
english: Tom couldn't open the door.

spanish: La anciana fue llevada al hospital, pero murió un poco más tarde.
finnish: Vanha nainen vietiin sairaalaan, mutta hän kuoli pian sen jälkeen.
english: The old woman was taken to a hospital, but she died not long after.

spanish: Tienes una habitación muy bonita.
english: You have a very nice room.

spanish: Ellos se van a encontrar mañana en el hotel.
english: They are going to meet at the hotel tomorrow.

spanish: Él debe ir allá mañana.
english: He must go there tomorrow.

spanish: No puedo abrir la puerta. ¿Tienes tú la llave?
finnish: En saa ovea auki. Onko sinulla avain?
english: I can't open the door. Do you have the key?

spanish: Subí las escaleras y me fui a dormir.
english: I went up the stairs and went to bed.

spanish: Vete a la cama.
english: Go to bed.

spanish: Dicen que la casa de veraneo de Liisa se incendió.
english: They say that Liisa's summer house burned down.

spanish: No podemos dormir a causa del ruido.
english: We can't sleep because of the noise.

spanish: Ellos llegaron tarde a causa de la tormenta.
english: They were late because of the storm.

spanish: Mi hermana limpia sus zapatos todos los domingos.
english: My sister washes her shoes every Sunday.

spanish: La casa está pintada de blanco.
english: The house is painted white.

spanish: Tenía una habitación con una hermosa vista de las montañas.
finnish: Minulla oli huone, josta oli kaunis näköala vuorille.
english: I had a room with a beautiful view of the mountains.

spanish: ¡Buenas noches y duerme bien!
english: Good night and sleep tight!

spanish: Te lo daré mañana.
english: I'll give it to you tomorrow.

spanish: Hay una película que quiero ver por TV mañana en la noche.
finnish: Televisiosta tulee huomenillalla elokuva, jonka tahdon katsoa.
english: There's a movie I want to watch on TV tomorrow night.

spanish: ¿Puedes dormir?
english: Can you sleep?

spanish: ¿Estás listo para la Noche de Brujas?
english: Are you ready for Halloween?

spanish: Llegué más tarde de lo usual.
english: I arrived later than usual.

spanish: Hablaré con Tom más tarde.
english: I'll talk to Tom later.

spanish: Pocos meses más tarde, Israel invadió Egipto.
finnish: Muutama kuukausi myöhemmin Israel hyökkäsi Egyptiin.
english: A few months later, Israel invaded Egypt.

spanish: Lo discutiremos más tarde.
english: We'll discuss it later.

spanish: Hablaremos de esto más tarde.
english: We'll talk about this later.

spanish: Te mostraré más tarde.
english: I'll show you later.

spanish: Estoy en medio de algo. ¿Podrías volver más tarde?
finnish: Olen kesken tekemisen. Voisitko tulla takaisin myöhemmin?
english: I'm in the middle of something. Could you come back later?

spanish: Estaba sorprendido de lo caro que eran los zapatos.
finnish: Olin hämmästynyt siitä kuinka kalliit kengät olivat
english: I was surprised at how expensive the shoes were.

spanish: Estos zapatos son demasiado caros.
english: These shoes are too expensive.

spanish: Estos zapatos son caros, y más encima, son demasiado chicos.
finnish: Nämä kengät ovat kalliit, ja muutenkin ne ovat liian pienet.
english: These shoes are expensive, and what is more, they are too small.

spanish: Estoy cansado de salir a comer todas las noches.
finnish: Olen kyllästynyt joka ilta ulkona syömiseen.
english: I'm sick of eating out every night.

spanish: Es justo medianoche.
english: It's just midnight.

spanish: Desperté pasada la medianoche.
english: I woke up after midnight.

spanish: ¿Tienen una mesa en el patio?
english: Do you have a table on the patio?

spanish: Él regresa a su casa.
english: He returns to his home.

spanish: Ahora ellos están casados.
english: They're married now.

spanish: Estaba hablando de ropa.
english: I was talking about clothes.

spanish: Su trabajo es planchar ropa.
english: Their job is to iron clothes.

spanish: La casa huele bien.
english: The house smells good.

spanish: Tom odia la Noche de Brujas.
english: Tom hates Halloween.

spanish: Nunca he estado en la casa de mi tío.
finnish: En ole koskaan ollut setäni kodissa.
english: I've never been to my uncle's house.

spanish: Al llegar a casa descubrí el robo.
english: On arriving home, I discovered the burglary.

spanish: Mi esposa normalmente no bebe café por la noche, y yo tampoco.
finnish: Vaimoni ei tavallisesti juo kahvia öisin, enkä juo minäkään.
english: My wife usually doesn't drink coffee at night, and neither do I.

spanish: Esta mañana él se veía mucho mejor que ayer.
finnish: Hän näytti tänä aamuna paljon paremmalta kuin eilen.
english: He looked much better this morning than yesterday.

spanish: Eso depende del tamaño de la silla.
english: It depends on the size of the chair.

spanish: También hay un baño en el cuarto piso.
english: There is also a toilet on the fourth floor.

spanish: Tom no tiene ganas de llevar a su perro a caminar esta mañana.
finnish: Tomia ei huvita viedä koiraansa kävelylle tänä aamuna.
english: Tom doesn't feel like taking a walk with his dog this morning.

spanish: Tom era el único hombre en la habitación.
english: Tom was the only man in the room.

spanish: Tom era casado, pero no usaba anillo.
finnish: Tom oli naimisissa mutta ei pitänyt sormusta.
english: Tom was married, but he didn't wear a ring.

spanish: Tom estuvo en las noticias anoche.
english: Tom was on the news last night.

spanish: La puerta del frente no se abre.
english: The front door won't open.

spanish: Tom tuvo un poco de problemas para encontrar la casa de María.
finnish: Tomilla oli hieman vaikeuksia löytää Maryn talolle.
english: Tom had a little trouble finding Mary's house.

spanish: Tom había bebido demasiado café así que no pudo dormir.
finnish: Tom oli juonut liian paljon kahvia eikä voinut nukkua.
english: Tom had drunk too much coffee so he couldn't sleep.

spanish: Pasé toda la tarde tratando de encontrar mis llaves.
finnish: Vietin koko illan yrittäen löytää avaimeni.
english: I spent the whole evening trying to find my keys.

spanish: Pasé toda la mañana con Tom.
english: I spent the whole morning with Tom.

spanish: Ella pasó toda la Navidad en casa con su familia.
finnish: Hän vietti kaikki joulunsa kotona perheensä kanssa.
english: She spent all of her Christmases at home with her family.

spanish: El baño de hombres está en el segundo piso.
english: The men's room is on the second floor.

spanish: Ellos pretenden casarse mañana.
english: They intend to get married tomorrow.

spanish: Me encontré con él en el camino del colegio a la casa.
english: I met him on my way home from school.

spanish: Me quedé en cama porque tenía un poco de fiebre.
finnish: Koska oli pientä kuumetta jäin vuoteeseen.
english: I stayed in bed because I had a bit of a fever.

spanish: Son solo las cinco de la mañana, y sin embargo afuera es de día.
finnish: Kello on vasta viisi aamulla, mutta joka tapauksessa ulkona on valoisaa.
english: It's just five in the morning, but nevertheless it is light out.

spanish: La entrada al baño está muy sucia.
english: The entrance to the toilet is very dirty.

spanish: Él quiere jugar fútbol esta tarde.
finnish: Hän haluaa pelata jalkapalloa tänä iltapäivänä.
english: He wants to play soccer this afternoon.

spanish: Deberían quedarse en cama.
english: You should stay in bed.

spanish: Me quedé otro día más en cama para estar seguro.
finnish: Pysyin vuoteessa vielä yhden päivän ollakseni varmoilla.
english: I stayed in bed one more day just to be on the safe side.

spanish: Esta noche quiero salir a comer.
english: I want to eat out tonight.

spanish: En Europa, las clases empiezan en septiembre.
english: School starts in September in Europe.

spanish: Alguien está en la casa.
english: Someone's in the house.

spanish: Tom está echado en la cama.
english: Tom is lying in bed.

spanish: ¿Tuviste una buena noche?
english: Did you have a nice evening?

spanish: Me devuelvo a dormir.
english: I'm going back to sleep.

spanish: A cada persona se le otorgó suficiente comida y ropa.
finnish: Kullekin annettiin riittävästi ruokaa ja vaatteita.
english: Each person was given enough food and clothing.

spanish: Viviré en un cuarto con cuatro camas.
finnish: Aion asua huoneessa, jossa on neljä vuodetta.
english: I will live in a room with four beds.

spanish: ¿Vendrá él esta noche?
english: Will he come this evening?

spanish: No deberías leer con tan poca luz.
finnish: Sinun ei pitäisi lukea noin heikossa valossa.
english: You shouldn't read in such poor light.

spanish: Tom trató de abrir la puerta, pero estaba con llave.
finnish: Tomi yritti avata ovea, mutta se oli lukossa.
english: Tom tried opening the door, but it was locked.

spanish: Te diré el resto mañana.
english: I will tell you the rest tomorrow.

spanish: Buitreé anoche.
english: Last night I threw up.

spanish: No le abriré la puerta a Tom.
english: I'm not opening the door for Tom.

spanish: La luz atrae polillas.
english: Moths are attracted by light.

spanish: Estuve toda la noche levantado pensando en eso.
finnish: Olen ollut ylhäällä koko yön ajatellen sitä.
english: I've been up all night thinking about that.

spanish: Tom corrió hacia la puerta y trató de salir.
finnish: Tom juoksi ovelle ja yritti päästä ulos.
english: Tom ran to the door and tried to get out.

spanish: Terminaré la tarea, sin importar cuánto tarde.
finnish: Huolimatta siitä kuinka kauan se kestää, teen työn valmiiksi.
english: No matter how long it takes, I will finish the work.

spanish: Encontré una nota en la mesa, pero no sé de quién es.
finnish: Löysin viestin pöydältä, mutta en tiedä keneltä se on.
english: I found a note on the table, but I don't know who it's from.

spanish: Los tres niños abrieron las puertas del edificio.
english: The three boys opened the doors of the building.

spanish: Hoy está nublado y hace frío; quizá nieve esta noche.
finnish: Tänään on pilvistä ja kylmää; saattaa sataa lunta tänä iltana.
english: Today, it's cloudy and cold; it might snow tonight.

spanish: Tom va a comprar una casa nueva el próximo año.
finnish: Tom ostaa uuden talon ensi vuonna.
english: Tom is buying a new house next year.

spanish: ¿Tiene Europa una lengua común?
english: Does Europe have a common language?

spanish: ¿Te arrepientes de haberte casado conmigo?
finnish: Kadutko sitä, että menit naimisiin kanssani?
english: Do you regret the fact that you married me?

spanish: Tom quiere cambiarse la ropa mojada por algo seco.
finnish: Tom haluaa vaihtaa märät vaatteensa johonkin kuivaan.
english: Tom wants to change out of his wet clothes into something dry.

spanish: ¡Ve a dormir!
english: Go to sleep.

spanish: Ellos estuvieron conmigo en esa habitación toda la noche.
finnish: He olivat siinä huoneessa koko yön minun kanssani.
english: They were in that room with me all night.

spanish: Tom tenía un gran moretón en la frente después de que chocó contra la puerta.
finnish: Tomilla oli iso mustelma otsassaan sen jälkeen kun hän käveli päin ovea.
english: Tom had a big bruise on his forehead after he walked into the door.

spanish: El comandante británico les ordenó a sus hombres que descansaran por la noche.
english: The British commander ordered his men to rest for the night.

spanish: Me voy a dormir.
english: I'm going to sleep.

spanish: La casa está a dos millas.
english: The house is two miles off.

spanish: ¿Hay una lavadora en la casa?
english: Is there a washing machine in the house?

spanish: Voy a estar solo en la casa toda la noche.
finnish: Tulen olemaan yksin kotona koko yön.
english: I'll be home alone all night.

spanish: Voy a estar sola en la casa toda la noche.
finnish: Tulen olemaan yksin kotona koko yön.
english: I'll be home alone all night.

spanish: Él jugará tenis mañana en la tarde.
english: He will be playing tennis tomorrow afternoon.

spanish: Quizá te diga las respuestas más tarde, pero antes trata de encontrarlas tú mismo.
finnish: Saatan kertoa vastaukset sinulle myöhemmin, mutta yritä selvittää ne ensin itseksesi.
english: I might tell you the answers later, but try to figure them out on your own first.

spanish: Según el periódico nevará mañana.
english: According to the paper, it will snow tomorrow.

spanish: Tom estaba apresurado así que dejó su cama sin hacer.
finnish: Tomilla oli kiire, niinpä hän jätti vuoteensa tekemättä.
english: Tom was in a hurry so he left his bed unmade.

spanish: Estoy cansada y me quiero ir a la cama.
finnish: Olen väsynyt ja haluan mennä nukkumaan.
english: I'm tired and I want to go to bed.

spanish: Me voy derecho para la casa.
english: I'm going straight home.

spanish: Había dos pares de zapatos en el piso.
english: On the floor were two pairs of shoes.

spanish: ¿Quieres que te llevemos de vuelta a tu casa?
finnish: Haluatko, että viemme sinut takaisin kotiisi?
english: Do you want us to take you back to your house?

spanish: Quisiera que Tom me llevara a casa.
english: I'd like Tom to take me home.

spanish: Me deshice de mis zapatos.
english: I threw away my shoes.

spanish: Fue una mañana ocupada.
english: It was a busy morning.

spanish: Tom ha estado haciendo preguntas estúpidas toda la mañana.
finnish: Tom on kysellyt typeriä kysymyksiä koko aamun.
english: Tom has been asking stupid questions all morning.

spanish: Anoche me emborraché e hice algo estúpido.
finnish: Olin humalassa viime yönä ja tein jotain typerää.
english: I got drunk last night and did something stupid.

spanish: Anoche hice algo estúpido.
english: I did a stupid thing last night.

spanish: La última semana he estado en cama con gripe.
english: I've been laid up with flu for the last week.

spanish: El baño está desocupado.
english: Bathroom's free.

spanish: Lávate las manos después de ir al baño, por favor.
english: Please wash your hands after using the bathroom.

spanish: Quizá debería irme temprano a casa hoy.
finnish: Minun ehkä pitäisi mennä aikaisin kotiin tänään.
english: I might have to go home early today.

spanish: Él dijo que se iba a casa al día siguiente.
finnish: Hän sanoi, että hän oli menossa kotiin seuraavana päivänä.
english: He said that he was going home the following day.

spanish: ¿Cuántos de ustedes planean estar aquí otra vez mañana?
finnish: Kuinka monta teistä suunnittelee olla täällä taas huomenna?
english: How many of you plan to be here again tomorrow?

spanish: ¡A levantarse!
english: Get up!

spanish: Tom está ordenando su habitación.
english: Tom is tidying his room.

spanish: Esta mañana me he levantado muy pronto.
finnish: Tänä aamuna nousin sängystä todella aikaisin.
english: I got up very early this morning.

spanish: Hay un abanico encima de la mesa.
english: There's a fan on the table.

spanish: Mañana voy a Boston.
english: I'm going to Boston tomorrow.

spanish: Tom hace su propio vino en casa.
english: Tom makes his own wine at home.

spanish: Tom y María se enamoraron y decidieron casarse.
finnish: Tom ja Mary rakastuivat ja päättivät mennä naimisiin.
english: Tom and Mary fell in love and decided to get married.

spanish: ¿Puedes llamar más tarde?
english: Can you call me later?

spanish: Lo podemos terminar más tarde.
english: We can finish it later.

spanish: Volvemos mañana.
english: We're coming back tomorrow.

spanish: Tom casi nunca estudia después de las diez de la noche.
finnish: Tom tuskin koskaan opiskelee kello 10:n jälkeen illalla.
english: Tom hardly ever studies after 10:00 p.m.

spanish: Tom no esperaba que María viniera tan temprano por la mañana.
finnish: Tom ei ollut odottanut Maryn tulevan niin aikaisin aamulla.
english: Tom hadn't expected Mary to come so early in the morning.

spanish: Se me cayó mi celular nuevo a la taza del baño. ¡Qué rabia!
finnish: Pudotin uuden kännykkäni vessanpönttöön. Nyt harmittaa!
english: I dropped my new cell phone into the toilet bowl. Damn it!

spanish: Llamaré a Tom mañana.
english: I'll call Tom tomorrow.

spanish: Le encanta la casa nueva.
english: He loves the new house.

spanish: Fuera de mi cama.
english: Get out of my bed.

spanish: ¿Puedo dormir esta noche en tu sofá?
english: May I sleep on your couch tonight?

spanish: Vi una luz al final del túnel.
english: I saw a light at the end of the tunnel.

spanish: Estos zapatos me calzan.
english: These shoes fit my feet.

spanish: Esos zapatos combinan bien con esa falda blanca.
finnish: Nämä kengät sopivat hyvin yhteen tämän valkoisen hameen kanssa.
english: Those shoes go well with this white skirt.

spanish: Mis dos hermanos están casados, pero todas mis hermanas son solteras.
finnish: Molemmat veljistäni ovat naimisissa, mutta siskoni ovat kaikki naimattomia.
english: Both my brothers are married, but my sisters are all single.

spanish: Mi abuelo toma café con un grupo de ancianos cada mañana.
finnish: Vaarini juo kahvia vanhusjoukon kanssa joka aamu.
english: My grandpa drinks coffee with a group of old guys every morning.

spanish: Tom nos cocina.
english: Tom cooks for us.

spanish: No me quiero casar, pero quiero tener hijos.
finnish: En halua mennä naimisiin, mutta haluan lapsia.
english: I don't want to get married, but I want to have kids.

spanish: Estamos cerca del despertar cuando soñamos que estamos soñando.
english: We are near awakening when we dream that we dream.

spanish: Tom estaba sentado de piernas cruzadas en su cama escribiendo en su notebook.
finnish: Tom istui risti-istunnassa sängyllään kirjoittamassa kannettavallaan.
english: Tom was sitting cross-legged on his bed, typing on his laptop.

spanish: ¿Así comías en tu casa?
english: So you ate at your house?

spanish: La cocina italiana es popular en todo el mundo.
finnish: Italialainen keittiö on suosittua ympäri maailman.
english: Italian cuisine is popular around the world.

spanish: ¿Cuál era el apellido de María antes de casarse?
finnish: Mikä Marin sukunimi olikaan ennen kuin hän meni naimisiin?
english: What was Mary's last name before she got married?

spanish: Casi todos los trabajadores se rehusaron a trabajar de noche.
finnish: Lähes kaikki työntekijät kieltäytyivät työskentelemästä öisin.
english: Almost all workers refused to work during the night.

spanish: He estado despierto la noche casi entera.
finnish: Olen ollut hereillä lähes koko yön.
english: I've been awake nearly all the night.

spanish: María necesita un rollo entero de papel higiénico para limpiarse el culo.
finnish: Mary tarvitsee kokonaisen vessapaperirullan pyyhkiäkseen perseensä puhtaaksi.
english: Mary needs a whole roll of toilet paper to wipe her ass clean.

spanish: Construiré una casa de madera.
english: I will build a wooden house.

spanish: Mi madre puso la mesa para la cena.
english: My mother set the table for dinner.

spanish: Nos casamos.
english: We got married.

spanish: Esta noche vi a Tom.
english: I saw Tom tonight.

spanish: Anoche se produjo un incendio en el supermercado.
english: A fire broke out in the supermarket last night.

spanish: No tengo intención de casarme.
finnish: Minulla ei ole aikomustakaan mennä naimisiin.
english: I have no intention of getting married.

spanish: Esta mañana he ido al trabajo en bicicleta.
english: This morning, I bicycled to work.

spanish: Parece que estás de mal humor esta mañana.
finnish: Vaikuttaa siltä, että olet huonolla tuulella tänä aamuna.
english: It seems like you're in a bad mood this morning.

spanish: El accidente ocurrió cerca a su casa.
english: The accident took place near his home.

spanish: La habitación estaba oscura.
english: The room was dark.

spanish: Podemos abrir las ventanas.
english: We can open the windows.

spanish: ¿Tomás está casado?
english: Is Tom married?

spanish: Fue una mañana perfecta.
english: It was a perfect morning.

spanish: Tomás rara vez está en su casa.
english: Tom is hardly ever at home.

spanish: Tom está limpiando su habitación.
english: Tom is cleaning his room.

spanish: Nos besamos en la oscuridad.
english: We kissed in the dark.

spanish: Tom se emborrachó anoche.
finnish: Tomi joi itsensä humalaan viime yönä.
english: Tom got drunk last night.

spanish: Tom es soltero y nunca ha estado casado.
finnish: Tomi on sinkku eikä ole koskaan ollut naimisissa.
english: Tom is single and has never been married.

spanish: ¿Cuánto cuesta el alquiler de esta habitación?
english: How much is the rent for this room?

spanish: Estuve toda la tarde charlando con amigos.
finnish: Vietin koko iltapäivän jutellen kavereideni kanssa.
english: I spent the whole afternoon chatting with friends.

spanish: Éste es mi par de zapatos favorito.
english: This is my favorite pair of shoes.

spanish: Los zapatos de Tom le están demasiado grandes.
finnish: Tomin kengät ovat liian suuret hänelle.
english: Tom's shoes are too big for him.

spanish: La habitación de Tom no está muy limpia.
finnish: Tomin huone ei ole kovin siisti.
english: Tom's room isn't very clean.

spanish: Los caballos están inquietos, quizás tengamos truenos esta noche.
finnish: Hevoset ovat levottomia — kenties illalla ukkostaa.
english: The horses are restless—perhaps we will have thunder tonight.

spanish: Mi casa está en el cuarto piso.
english: My home is on the fourth floor.

spanish: Vivo en una casa adosada.
english: I live in a terraced house.

spanish: Lo primero que hizo fue limpiar las armas.
english: The first thing he did was clean the weapons.

spanish: Tom murió el lunes por la mañana.
english: Tom died Monday morning.

spanish: No dejes la luz encendida.
english: Don't leave the light on.

spanish: Tom encendió la luz.
english: Tom turned on the light.

spanish: No había nadie en esa habitación cuando yo fui.
finnish: Siellä huoneessa ei ollut ketään kun tulin.
english: There was no one in that room when I went.

spanish: En nuestra casa está permitido todo lo que no esté explícitamente prohibido.
finnish: Meidän kodissamme on sallittua kaikki se, mikä ei ole erikseen kiellettyä.
english: In our house, anything that isn't prohibited is fair game.

spanish: Mañana es día de pago.
english: Tomorrow is payday.

spanish: Somos recién casados.
english: We're newlyweds.

spanish: Estábamos recién casados.
english: We were newlyweds.

spanish: Suelo dormir ocho horas.
english: I usually sleep eight hours.

spanish: No he podido dormir bien últimamente.
finnish: En ole nukkunut kovin hyvin viime aikoina.
english: I haven't been able to sleep very well lately.

spanish: Ese ruido me impide dormir.
finnish: En saa unta tuon melun takia.
english: That noise keeps me from sleeping.

spanish: Duermo en una cama grande.
english: I sleep in a big bed.

spanish: La mesa no está sucia.
english: The table isn't dirty.

spanish: ¿Está sucia la mesa?
english: Is that table dirty?

spanish: Últimamente no he podido dormir lo suficiente.
finnish: Viime aikoina en ole saanut tarpeeksi unta.
english: I haven't been able to get enough sleep lately.

spanish: Cocina el arroz.
english: Cook the rice.

spanish: Anoche tuve un sueño muy raro.
finnish: Viime yönä näin todella outoa unta.
english: I had a very strange dream last night.

spanish: Tuve un sueño muy extraño anoche.
finnish: Viime yönä näin todella outoa unta.
english: I had a very strange dream last night.

spanish: Mañana, si Dios quiere, estaremos con tus padres.
finnish: Huomenna, jos Luoja suo, olemme vanhempiesi kanssa.
english: Tomorrow, God willing, we'll be with your parents.

spanish: Lavé las ventanas.
english: I washed the windows.

spanish: Habrá un eclipse lunar mañana.
english: There will be a lunar eclipse tomorrow.

spanish: Puso la mesa para la cena.
english: She set the table for supper.

spanish: No voy a competir mañana.
english: I'm not going to compete tomorrow.

spanish: Acabamos de casarnos.
english: We just got married.

spanish: Mañana es el día.
english: Tomorrow's the day.

spanish: ¿Hasta mañana?
english: See you tomorrow?

spanish: Tom se quedó en casa.
english: Tom stayed home.

spanish: Buenas noches, Tom. "Buenas noches, Mary."
english: Good night, Tom. "Good night, Mary."

spanish: No abran la puerta.
english: Don't open the door.

spanish: No abráis la puerta.
english: Don't open the door.

spanish: Europa no existe.
english: Europe doesn't exist.
